title: Woman fatally shot in Caledonia hunting accident
content:
UPDATE: The shooter has been identified as 50-year-old John Lander of Rochester. The victim is a 45-year-old woman from Rochester. The victim’s name is not being released at this time at the request of the family.
A woman was fatally shot in the abdomen in a hunting accident in Caledonia on Sunday, according to Sheriff Thomas Dougherty and an officer from the Department of Environmental Conservation.
The woman, who was in a hunting party of four or five people, died at Strong Memorial Hospital. Her identity, as well as who shot her, has not been released at this point.
The shooting took place in the area of River Road in Caledonia, about a half-mile away from a private driveway.
While no one has been charged, authorities are not ruling out the possibility of charges. This is the third hunting death in Livingston County this season.
"Please, as a public safety for all of our hunters, as well as just regular firearm safety," said New York State DEC Lieutenant Joshua Verhague, "The sheriff and I, the DA's, all law enforcement, cannot stress enough the firearm safety that comes into play, especially during hunting season."
This is a developing story and will be updated as more information becomes available.
